intro: Nardurus tenuiflorus var. aristatus, commonly known as the slender-flowered nardus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale blue flowers. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often forming dense mats on the ground. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
